meanings.definition: Able to live both on land and in water.
meanings.sent1: The frog is amphibious, meaning it can survive in water and on land.
meanings.sent2: The turtle is an amphibious creature, comfortable in both water and on land.
meanings.sent3: The amphibious duck enjoyed swimming in the pond and then waddling on the grass.
meanings.sent4: The amphibious nature of the platypus makes it a unique creature in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The amphibious salamander moved gracefully from the stream to the forest floor.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of animals that can live both on land and in water.
meanings.sent1: The amphibious lifestyle of the otter allows it to thrive in various environments.
meanings.sent2: The amphibious nature of seals enables them to hunt in the ocean and rest on land.
meanings.sent3: The amphibious penguin decided to take a stroll on the beach before diving back into the sea.
meanings.sent4: The amphibious behavior of the crocodile makes it a formidable predator in water and on land.
meanings.sent5: The amphibious frog displayed its versatility by hopping from the pond to the meadow.

meanings.definition: Capable of operating on both land and water.
meanings.sent1: The amphibious vehicle smoothly transitioned from the road to the river.
meanings.sent2: The amphibious aircraft landed on the runway and then took off from the water.
meanings.sent3: The amphibious car caused a stir as it drove straight into the lake and kept going.
meanings.sent4: The amphibious robot amazed everyone by seamlessly moving between the beach and the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The amphibious tractor proved its worth by plowing fields and crossing streams with ease.
